pli-tv-bu-vb-sk45:1.3.1: According to [Sp.2.621]() this means repeatedly breaking pieces off a ball of food. The word _avacchedaka_, is further explained at [Vin-vn-ṭ.1920]() as _chinditvā_, “having broken off”. This, it seems, can only refer to breaking off pieces, not to biting. Each  ball of food was a single a mouthful, consisting of rice with suitable curry.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk45:1.11: According to [Sp.2.615]() _khajjaka_ refers to all fresh foods: _Ettha mūlakhādanīyādi sabbaṁ gahetabbaṁ_, “Here the fresh foods which are roots, etc. may all be taken.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk45:1.13: _Uttaribhaṅga_. According to [Vin-vn-ṭ.1907]() this is just another word for _byañjana_: _uttaribhaṅgaṁ nāma byañjanaṁ_. _Byañjana_ seems to refer to curries apart from the standard bean-curries, which are called _sūpa_.
